website_summaries.verdict: The New Balance Fresh Foam 1080 v10 is a highly cushioned neutral running shoe that received significant updates, making it lightweight and flexible. Though there were a few consumers who experienced pain and discomfort, the majority of the consumers have recommended this everyday running shoe for its cushioning quality, lightweight structure, and durability.
pros: A lot of runners mentioned that the Fresh Foam 1080 v10 is comfortable
The shoe is durable, based on some reviews
It is lightweight, according to some commenters
Numerous purchasers noted that it is well-cushioned
The shoe offers good support, reported some testers
One buyer mentioned that it is perfect for long runs
Several people love the flexible midsole of this running shoe
cons: A couple of users experienced foot pain and blisters while running in the shoe
The shoe is a bit tight and constricting, said a few consumers

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe. Design might need more focus.
customer_reviews.text: This particular shoe felt good while running on a track (gravel surface) with minimal impact on each stride. If you reference my picture, you can see where the issue with friction occurs. The outside ankle bone is irritated by the low design of the shoes material. This might be isolated to certain runners with particular feet, I’m not sure. It’s not a manufacturer’s fault that one shoe can’t accommodate the vast types of feet. So I would frankly pay attention to details in design and make your own judgement. I am deciding to keep this shoe and make slight adjustments (cutting) to that particular area. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Too tight, disappointed poor design
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Far departure from the v9 I do not have wide feet however these shoes squish my feet. I wear a 10 in everything and these are too tight around my toes and mid foot. Tried 10 wide and there’s too much room around the the forefoot, however the mid foot is still too tight. V9’s fit perfect, v10’s are going back, shame
customer_reviews.author: Se

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding. I have been an avid runner for almost 20 years and these are the best shoes I have ever had. I am nowhere near elite speeds, I don’t find these overly soft or speed limiting up to 7min/mile paces.
customer_reviews.author: MSR

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design
customer_reviews.text: I have the V7 version of these shoes and they are the most comfortable running shoes ever. That’s why expectations were high when I bought the v10 model, which has been disappointing to say the least. It’s a terrible shoe design because your foot doesn’t sit deep enough in the shoe, giving you the feel of wearing slippers where your heel just slides around. Just walking around the house made my feet hurt. I am extremely dissapointed with this garbage shoe and will have to switch brands again.
customer_reviews.author: melnooo14

customer_reviews.title: So far - great
customer_reviews.text: I ordered mine 'wide' and I'm glad I did. It feels a little tight on top of my foot even with the laces loosened way up. All that being said I love these shoes. They are so comfortable for walking around. I haven't tried to run in them yet but I'm thinking I'll order another pair forerunning soon. I'm replacing my Hoku One's and so far I love these.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Dee !!!

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, like it
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Very light and comfortable. Ordered 4E width and it is just right --- The fit and finish of the 1080v10 is good.
customer_reviews.author: Solo

customer_reviews.title: v10 - Great Update!
customer_reviews.text: Softer, more responsive, better heel fit from an already outstanding neutral, cushioned trainer. Daily trainer for the year.
customer_reviews.author: kathy connor

customer_reviews.title: Bees knees
customer_reviews.text: Aside from being totally stylish, these shoes are fantastic for distance running. I barely feel the road which in that case is what I want. All of my joints feel like they are being held up by clouds. I feel like I still have a very good support. And if the video comes through, you will see that I even used them on 100 200 and 400 meter sprints.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I guess I've bought a dozen or so New Balance running shoes over the years and wore them all out, but the Fresh Foam shoes just don't work. Yes, they are soft and protect the joints. But I cannot run or walk for much more than a mile before the balls of my feet start to fall asleep and turn to fire. It is really painful. Surprisingly so. I thought I would get used to it, but not so. It is always the same. Only good for a mile before the pain takes over.
customer_reviews.author: Doyle W Patton

customer_reviews.title: Absorbs a lot of shock
customer_reviews.text: I've wear these for brisk walks both on the treadmill and outside and also use these for work. My feet feel great in these when I'm on them all day. I get about 25000 steps a day, and I have to say my feet feel fine at the end of the day. I know that I wear a 11 4E which is consistent from New Balance. Out of the many many pairs of New Balance shoes I've owned, these have been the best at cushioning my legs from the impact of concrete all day and they are very light. Good job👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: TheGreatBigHead

customer_reviews.title: Used shoes!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not doing this review based off the shoe. These shoes are used. First off it was shipped in a amazon shoe box. Didnt come in the original new balance box. Secon the bottom of the shoes are dirty and has scuff marks which means they have been worn. I didnt even try them on. I am not paying this price for used shoes.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: What a fiasco
customer_reviews.text: first ordered V 10 in same size as my V9 which I've had for 6moths and they were too short. Then ordered V9 in my same size as other. too short. Then ordered V 10 1/2 size larger and they were too narrow. Really hurt the top of my feet. Finally ordered 1/2 size up from my V9 9 and a wide. Eureka they fit! just not same company as when shoes were made in US. You don't know what size or width to order. 1/2 size up and wide in width. Thankful these fit. Don't know what to order next time.
customer_reviews.author: Judge

customer_reviews.title: 2 month update
customer_reviews.text: Starting off, I loved the cushion in these shoes. I could barely walk 2 miles without pain from my Asics. After my 1st walk in these, my pain was gone. And within a few weeks I was walking 4 to 6 miles a day on blacktop. Even had a few 14 mile days. BUT... the bottoms wore out fast under my forefoot and in the center where my heel strikes. There's actually a hole there! I estimate I've walked 150 to 175 miles in them. Other than the soles wearing out super fast, I loved them.
customer_reviews.author: J Turner

customer_reviews.title: Good fit even after surgery.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had recent surgery on my right foot which concerned me a bit from a fitting standpoint. But with slightly loosened strings, it’s fine, and I can tighten as swelling goes down. It’s a very flexible fit.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe!
customer_reviews.text: In 5 months, I have put over 650 miles on these shoes. I ordered wide, but the shoe fits snug and eases up and fits perfectly after the first half mile or so. The traction is good for shoulder running and is cushioned enough for the asphalt. These are the absolute best road shoes I have run in. Asics gel wide size we're my staple for a long time but I'm liking these New Balance. I tend to supinate, so the tread is coming off on the outside of the sole, but hey, I got a lot of mileage on these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: sjaz556

customer_reviews.title: Cushioned for heavy runners
customer_reviews.text: These are great for “heavier” runners. I’m 5’11” and 215 and lift weights first and think about running as an afterthought. With that said, when I do run they have perfect amount of cushion for me. They feel like the right width and I like the minimalist upper heel that lacks cushion for extra rubbing. These are really light as well, which is a rare feature on a thick cushioned runner. I see myself buying another pair of these when this pair wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Very supportive!
customer_reviews.text: I picked these up because I needed a narrow fit and I have high arches. The black shoes have more character in person. The daylight brings out more contrast between the black and grey. The fresh foam allows my foot to flex naturally and provides immense support. I have very bad ankles and can usually not walk very far without discomfort. However, I do not feel any discomfort with these shoes. The material of the shoe also flexes with your foot. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: James Nelson

customer_reviews.title: FRONT RUNNERS (punintentional:)
customer_reviews.text: WoW!! What a great running shoe. Mizuno Wave Riders have been my go to for years, and I recently purchased a pair of Nike Vaporfly 4%, which took a little getting used to, but these 1080v10's are WICKED AWESOME!!! I am not a crazy runner, but do run 3 to 4 miles several times a week, and 2-3 half marathons per year. This year I will be running them in my 1080v10's. I am not advocating exclusively for New Balance, but currently, for me, these are my favorites.
customer_reviews.author: paul burke

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Prime try before buying😊 Great help for bad knees & back❗ Cushion support is fantastic💯 My husband didn't realize how much his walking had changed. Time for break-in, zero. They are great for arch support, breathable & oh so comfortable. He likes that they are minimalistic on the outside so his toes don't rub on anything. The price is outrageous, but my husband is worth it💚
customer_reviews.author: Maj Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very shallow, not recomended for high arch feet.
customer_reviews.text: The fit in terms of size is OK, but it is very shalow, specially in the upper part of the foot. The tongue in this model stars in the thris eyelet, and the stitches reduce flexibility in this area. So, even when the upper material is very flexible, these stitches reduce flexibility making the shoe very uncorfotable. This will happen if you have a high arch, like in my case. I took the innersole out, still very shallow. I had the same situation with the Adidas Ultraboos 19. Boths very good shoes, very well made, but very unconfortable for high arch feet.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Broken within 2 months, $150 down the tube
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes now for two months, and it always felt like the left one was looser than the right but I chalked it up to maybe some minor issue in manufacturing that I could live with. Just today I picked up the shoes and noticed that the back side of the shoe (which has a solid, apparently plastic, core) is cracked and splits apart when pushed from the inside. Since they've had this fit issue since arriving, I have to assume they arrived broken. For a $150 shoe, this is unacceptable. I don't use them heavily, and they've not been put under any sort of extreme load. Cannot recommend these shoes due to build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Decent running shoe , Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Had these for six months, I’m not overly impressed. Pro: The fit is very comfortable and will feel nice for SHORT distances. the thick and light weight shoe sole have helped improve my run times and lessen the impact on my knees. Cons: The shoes have very Limited support for side to side movement and the sole of the shoe are tilted and so they are not good for any sport or work out other than running. So far with limited use I’ve noticed significant wear n tear; durability is low. I do you long distance running and have several foot injuries.
customer_reviews.author: israel

customer_reviews.title: Buy these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear Hoka Bondi, these are better. Like walking on pillows Great support and tons of cushion
customer_reviews.author: Paula Cousineau

customer_reviews.title: NB ruined the perfect shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned the 1080 in both V8 and V9. The 9 is perfect. This 10 sucks. They made the shoe narrower and the tongue is attached to sides with a tight elastic. It’s so tight it cuts off the blood to my toes. I tried both the regular and the wide. It’s a shame. Great looking shoe and the foam feels great but they screwed up the upper. Please fix it for the 11.
customer_reviews.author: B. Blevins

customer_reviews.title: Comfort of royalty!  Molded sole also fairly stable.  They got it right.
customer_reviews.text: Best cushion ever. I can run 2-3 miles with almost no hip joint pain. A little tight through forefoot but seems to break in feeling somewhat better now. I have a medium to slightly wide and flat foot. Consider ordering wide if you have a wide-ish foot. Still gets five stars!
customer_reviews.author: IA Bond

customer_reviews.title: For the price of this item, find a shoe with an outer sole that extends the full length of the shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Toe box narrower than prior model but not as disappointing is the omission of a full outer sole rubber that extends the length of the shoe. Look at the first picture above. Note the white area that is all chewed up. I’ve only placed 30 miles or less on this shoe and it’s badly worn. The material is most likely a part of the soft midsole that’s meant to cushion the foot plant. The second shoe is an earlier model of the 1080v. Note the outer sole extending the length of the shoe. I’m a heel striker and I placed at least 120 miles on this shoe. Same model. Better mileage.
customer_reviews.author: Hanumtasi

customer_reviews.title: Better than V8 and comfortable in XW
customer_reviews.text: 1080V8 had a soft cushion around the back. Inside above the heel wore out in less than a year. V10 doesn't have that. The heel fits better. Toe box with XW is a good fit. They run shorter than most so I got 11 1/2. There is a little extra length and 11 might be better, but when walking my feet sometimes slide forward so I'll keep these.
customer_reviews.author: K. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy the shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe because it seemed to have unanimous praise from various Youtube personalities and running forums, and so far it has delivered. I purchased size 14 wide. I am a larger runner (6'5" 225lbs) and this shoe has a very nice balance between cushioning and responsiveness. My longest run to date has been 5 miles so can't really speak to performance on greater distances, but it has gotten the job done for me so far. Plus, I like the bold red/orange coloring and the overall design is very stylish. Hoping it lasts for a few hundred miles.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Feels Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Seriously love these shoes feels like I'm running on clouds! It feels a little funny around the back heel but other than that GET THESE!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rich

customer_reviews.title: amazing comfort
customer_reviews.text: I was I bit skeptic and read a lot and a lot of reviews before I bought those! I went to the store to try my size, I actually tried the previous model, I just want it to make sure it fits right. I have to say I love all kind of brands, but this New Balance is absolutely the best of all of I ever had! great buy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are very comfortable like wearing house shoes. Run a little smaller than regular size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not use American shoe sizes with foreign made shoes. Especially New Balance and PUMA
customer_reviews.text: I always wear size 9.5. I bought 9.5 PUMA’S from Amazon, but traded them at a local Dallas Puma store and required a size 13. Maybe these 10’s should have been 13’s “PLUS”. I wish athletic shoes were like leather shoes. Commensurate with your normal size. It’s a crap shoot as I see it. Kenny
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Pirkle

customer_reviews.title: Ankle Blisters
customer_reviews.text: I have put about 100 miles on these and really wanted to love them. Overall, the ride is pretty soft. The shoe really locks your foot in place. I was worried about lack of space in the toe, but the material is really flexible so I don't notice the slightly tighter fit. I wouldn't hesitate to do runs of any length in these, though I'm only doing 20-30 miles a week right now. The one thing that is a dealbreaker for me is that the seam on the outer ankle has given me blisters on both feet. If New Balance can eliminate that seam, they will have an awesome shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Sole wearing already
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these for my husband who has Planter Fasciitis, although they feel GREAT, the sole is already starting to wear out after less than 1 month. My husband has been very careful to only wear these shoes to run at the park (since the gym is closed), so I'm disappointed the soles are wearing out already. I gave this 3 stars because he says they are super comfortable but hate the soles don't hold up better.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie Y

customer_reviews.title: Wear every Tuesday run
customer_reviews.text: My Clifton 6 is a more cushy shoe but this felt almost as good. And it was faster. I like a wide bottom shoe...I don’t like feeling like my ankles might roll. On the first run my I raced looped the right shoe, but neither shoe felt any heel slippage. But the left laces were too long, so, I’ll race loop both so the laces don’t flap against my ankle. Worth putting in the rotation
customer_reviews.author: ST CLAIR MELLARD

customer_reviews.title: Sneaker looks awesome...
customer_reviews.text: ...but it tore up my ankles. The stitching on the inside below the ankle rubbed against my skin that I bled during my first run. I thought I just needed to break them in but it’s not any better. This pair of sneakers are unusable to me without pain and discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: dwmaldonado

customer_reviews.title: What I expected !
customer_reviews.text: From the Top of the Line running shoe. I run and walk for fun and want the most durable, good support, softest. As soon as I put them on, I noticed the complete difference! These are made by professionals that know what is needed and have years of experience. My hat is off to them. Thanks a ton!
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: This Shoe Works for You
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a mid striker and a lazy shopper. So I tried to fix the latter by doing some research and found these shoes. My dad's been wearing New Balance for years but I was always smitten with the swoosh of another shoe. But I went ahead and took the internet's advice and have been really pleased with the result. These are the first running shoes I feel have actually gone past just holding up well and being comfortable to actually positively impact my runs.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Loved the appearance....not the fit
customer_reviews.text: After owning 3 pairs of NB1080V8, this seemed like a great choice.....until trying them on. Very snug/small/not as wide as 1080v10 regular width. Considered a 2E but decided to return. Really wanted to love that shoe!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: The best 1080 from New Balance (so far)
customer_reviews.text: I'm wearing this shoe for a couple month now. Really nice running shoe for long distance running, it's durable and comfy. I've previously own 1080 v8, and v9 but this v10 is much more better than it's predecessors. The v8 is too heavy and v9 has a wired fit around the heel.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Walking on a cloud!
customer_reviews.text: Wow these are like walking on a cloud my only complaint is with the wrong socks at times my left ankle does Rub a little other than that best you ever! I feel like I downgrade every time I put on other shoes as far as softness an comfort!
customer_reviews.author: alterd1

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of 1080V10 and will stick with them. Have been very satisfied with overall fit. For my foot, the cushioning, toe box and heel are just right. Run around 30 miles/week and satisfied with wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sizing. Perfect everything
customer_reviews.text: Size 14 narrow and for the first time ever the shoes fit perfectly. I also like the tab at the top of the heel and the sewn in elastic based liner.
customer_reviews.author: Wion

customer_reviews.title: Orange sharpie to the yellow part
customer_reviews.text: I hated the yellow on this shoe. It doesn’t belong. Took an orange sharpie to it and viola. Looks so much better!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So sad...
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet, so it's really hard to find good shoes. I've been wearing the 1080's for the past 5 versions. Something is very different about the heel of these. It's slips really bad, so I'll be returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Less shoe so less support
customer_reviews.text: The old 1080s were far more supportive better quality and foot friendly. The new version -1090- has a steeper foot cradle so that the toes are put through more stress. Though a lighter shoe - the shoe will last a third as long as the old version. Better news is the Achilles area. They have soften the internal plastic so that the plastic no longer cuts into the Achilles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cushion during long runs
customer_reviews.text: Shoes used for endurance runs. It fit exactly as described and has great cushion while running. Also these shoes are well made. My only reason for 3 stars is, they are pricey.i recommend and would order again.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley 7

customer_reviews.title: Most luxurious running shoe ever!
customer_reviews.text: All i have to say is these shoes are the most comfortable running shoes i have ever worn! They feel like walking on clouds and running in them is so comfortable and luxurious. Great shoe! I don't want to take them off! You can walk for miles in these.
customer_reviews.author: KoolKeita

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother with V10
customer_reviews.text: Sorry Folks, the V10 is a big disappointment. I run 15 miles or less a week, and only had a few weeks with this shoe before I had to switch back to my older V9. I’ve now had the V10 about 6 months for mainly walking and they are shot. Now I’m hunting for a new set of V9’s. The Arch on one foot felt higher at the beginning, and now the arch is blown out. I suspect there was a quality control issue on the one shoe. First time I have had this experience with New Balance.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Full price for a used pair?
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I got a used pair or not. Paying full price I expect a new pair. The tags and stickers were removed from the shoes. They were looking clean enough and I can't see any wear on the soles.... It would be great to have the tags on the shoes when they arrive. This review is not a reflection of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: One of the most comfortable out there
customer_reviews.text: I tried different ones to wear for whole day walking, work in the office etc. I have wide feet and this one is the most comfortable compare to Hoka One One, Saucony, Under Armor etc.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Cuts the ankle
customer_reviews.text: I previously had v9, which was great. Now that I have v10, the design change has me unhappy with the shoe. Similar to other reviews, the cut of the shoe on the outside badly irritates my ankle bone. It’s a total redesign for that part of the shoe that should have been left as it was. Even wearing thick socks that cover the ankle, it’s still causing enough irritation to break the skin during runs as short as 4 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Bond007

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable running shoes i’ve ever owned. They feel light on my feet. I bought the wide version which works well for me. I already want to buy a 2nd pair in a different color to have a variety.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting and works well
customer_reviews.text: Very good fit. The cushion is why I bought the shoes and was not disappointed. Has help me with running due to the way shoe if built and functions.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Burns

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and favorite shoe
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves the 1080s and is very impressed with the v10. He said the cushioning is amazing. He’s a 4E and the extra wide was perfect. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Messy Miracles

customer_reviews.title: Padding
customer_reviews.text: Didn't have quite the padding I was wanting. So far, without using insoles, the only shoe built with enough cushioning is Hoka One One.
customer_reviews.author: David Loring

customer_reviews.title: My favorite running shoe do far.
customer_reviews.text: Seems a step beyond the traditional running shoe the previous version was. Very comfortable. Great support and shock absorption.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit New Balance on Amazon?
customer_reviews.text: Bought does shoes in late May, and has been using them since. Aprox 10 miles of running every week, in August the outsole had significant tear and in September the inner backstay/heel on the inside had a open tear. Could this be counterfeit shoes sold trough Amazon? Since New Balance should be shoes with high quality and normally has a much longer lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: BA Johansen

customer_reviews.title: This is a review for people with high-arches
customer_reviews.text: If you have high-arches don't buy these! The laces are fixed in the front which means you can't loosen them adequately. You can go about a mile than that it. I'm used to needing to break in my shoes but these wont due to the front lacing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark cooper

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: They fit as they should. These are really lightweight and bouncy. Great fit. Comfortable. Flashy. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Jean

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy, with a good fit.
customer_reviews.text: I like this shoe. The heal cup looks and fits a little differently, but it feels fine. The normal width (D) is snug, so the foot doesn't squirm around even with light socks. There is plenty of shock absorbing foam, so the it's comfortable and supportive through long workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Dave

customer_reviews.title: Love this shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good for long runs - responsive but with good cushioning. I just burn through them too quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S Bronk

customer_reviews.title: Really impressed with the comfort
customer_reviews.text: I have reoccurring plantar fasciitis and im really impressed by the comfort of these shoes. I now use them not only for running but pretty much for everything except work. It does take it a little bit to brake in. In noticed the after the first few runs that my feet where pretty sore. Now after a week im noticing my feet starting to feel better then in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is the one style of New Balance that is most comfortable and comes in extra wide widths
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A bit of a disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: I am a daily runner, approximately 5 miles each workout. While the fresh foam shoes initially fit well and felt comfortable, after going on a few paved trails I began to experience a lot of pain in my feet. The ankle support is not great and the style is conducive to an experience of minor metatarsalgia. For the price and reputation, I would have expected more from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em
customer_reviews.text: I went with these based on the Runner's World review. First pair of NB's in forever, but I'm super happy with them. Did around 30km in the first week. Good cushion without being "squishy". Nice support on the heel - Achilles feels better after a long run in these than my other shoes (Brooks and OnCloud). Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sean R. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Sizing
customer_reviews.text: The tongue is sewn in which may affect the fit. The shoe is what I expect. Very comfortable with a lot of cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Cally

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my husband who had bad knees from running. He can now run more comfortably and I’m actually very surprised!
customer_reviews.author: S. Waller

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable shoes I've ever worn. I felt as if I could run anywhere as soon as I stood up. I'm no runner at all, but I can run faster than ever before and felt great afterwards. Thanks for the opportunity to own such a great pair of New Balance!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Smart

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoe feels stable, it is comfortable and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: lois rapp

customer_reviews.title: Narrow fit
customer_reviews.text: I take a 13 4E and If you need an xtra wide toe box don’t buy. The width is terribly narrow and toe box tight on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY BUONINCONTRI

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and cushiony
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are more cushiony than other NB shoes that I have worn. I like the long extension at the heel, because my heel doesn’t slide in the shoe. I highly recommend this shoe!
customer_reviews.author: David Metzger

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe so far
customer_reviews.text: Color is great, for is really good, not a lot of arch support, but not uncommon with new balance
customer_reviews.author: MikE

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Great for standing all day at work for 8+ hours. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Brandonhughes7

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS A MUST BUY
customer_reviews.text: I love them.. A little tight around the roof of the shoe but extremely comfortable!.. I just think that I need to get them worn in .. I definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size is Not True to Fit, 4E Not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: I have worn 9.5 4E 1080s since version 1. These are not wide at all, way too tight. Very disappointed, New Balance usually is spot on with size. These hurt like hell.
customer_reviews.author: Troy S

customer_reviews.title: Running shoes are fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I run or walk everyday and the running shoes are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: John Clemons

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. They are like strapping clouds to your feet! I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good arch support and heel cushioning
customer_reviews.text: Good arch support and excellent cushion on the heel. Bought a second pair. Look great! 😊
customer_reviews.author: Slam Bones

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Value
customer_reviews.text: I am an advid long distance walker. I was pleasantly surprised how much cushion and comfort the shoe provided with almost no break in required. I was concerned about paying a premium for an expensive shoe. I am very satisfied with my investment. I will definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Miller

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: I've tried them all, from brooks to nike to hoka to asics. These are the best, they're light, comfortable, and will allow you to crush miles with a confidence you've never had before. Must buy
customer_reviews.author: Adam Collins

customer_reviews.title: First Class High Mileage Trainer
customer_reviews.text: Amazing ride! This is a high mileage trainer with all the technology of a racer. Love the Achilles room and only noticed debris coming in on wet roads. Some outside ankle rubbing when walking however I have no issues once running. Seems durable and well made. Nice toe box room while still feeling secure in mid foot and heel. Exactly what I was looking for, well done NB
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Súper tennis/ súper shoes
customer_reviews.text: Este par de tennis es el primero que compro de esta marca, un súper tennis muy cómodo para Caminar y correr lo recomiendo al 100%. This is the first running shoes from this company, in very happy, this shoes is very comfortable for running and walking, I recomend this shoes at 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Salvador F. Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: I am a New Balance fan! But this shoe has been really disappointing. The shoe fits great and is great to run in, but whatever material the bottom is made from is not built to last running 30-40 miles a week. I loved the old 1080 shoe and wish they would have never replaced it with this version.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Read

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and value
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, runs a bit narrow if you have a bigger foot. If you tend to wear wide sizes, you probably should order these wide.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality and durability.
customer_reviews.text: Very bad quality, the soy torn off after 2 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Mahalik007

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I usually have difficulty finding comfortable running shoes due to wider than average feet but these sneakers are very comfortable. It usually takes a while to break them in but I’ve been running with these since the second time I’ve worn them. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Avras

customer_reviews.title: Best fitting (for me)
customer_reviews.text: I got fit on the Volumental 3D scanner at the NB flagship store in Boston and this is my 2nd pair. I knew the fit would be perfect as I have been scanned and had a great experience with my first pair. These are durable, breathable and amazingly comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe Great price delivered before my next run!
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe. Been running in the 1080 for years. The V10 is a cut above.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: NB 1080v10 a great athletic shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great comfort and fit. Intended use is for walking and hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Buck

customer_reviews.title: Nb fresh foam v10
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing NB 1080 fresh foams since the V6. They we’re my Go to running sneakers. This is my second V10 but I’ve had nothing but issues with this Particular pair and I dont know why? They don’t fit as expected, they’re too tight and very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: Order a wide size if you are questioning normal or wide
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the normal width but had to return and got the wide. Great show!! If you get the new balance 994s normal width, I would suggest getting the wide sizes for this shoe as it’s a bit more narrow. Great fit on the wide and a great running shoe overall!
customer_reviews.author: Pierce Bush

customer_reviews.title: Great, go to running shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great for recovery days. Nice soft bounce and are very comfortable. The thing on the back of the heel is a bit weird looking, but not noticeable while wearing. The toe box was somewhat tight at first, but loosened up after just a couple runs. Overall they’re a great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Stewart

customer_reviews.title: life saver
customer_reviews.text: Had issues with my knee during and after exercise and was advised to get a running shoes. I read multiple reviews and landed on this 1080 V10. my knee feels better and walking has never been so easy.
customer_reviews.author: mimi

customer_reviews.title: Not your typical cushioned running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable stable running shoe. For such a cushion running shoe very light and can turnover this shoe especially on long runs
customer_reviews.author: Morris M. Rehn

customer_reviews.title: Your feet may need time to adjust
customer_reviews.text: I had the hoka Bondi six before this one. They’re not as comfortable as the hoka’s.
customer_reviews.author: Guinel gue

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍
customer_reviews.text: Loved the shoe , best running shoe I’ve had by far . I’m 278 lbs 5”11 , really good on my knees and feet . I ordered half size bigger than my usual size and it fit perfect .
customer_reviews.author: Angelooo

customer_reviews.title: Favorite brand
customer_reviews.text: Husband says these are the perfect walking shoe. Room in the toe box and light weight!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Jones

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. For big guys too.
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoes I've ever worn. Ex athlete 6'8 275 great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: shoe is hard and stiff.. i wish i didn't buy it !
customer_reviews.text: shoe is hard and stiff.. i wish i didn't buy it !
customer_reviews.author: w

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's 1080v10 Fresh Foam Running Shoe
product_meta.description: The New Balance 1080v10 offers a sleek design with data driven convenience. This responsive runner is equipped with NB's signature fresh foam cushioning to encourage you kilometers by mile.
